intro: Calyptranthes tovarensis, commonly known as the Tovar Island hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Tovar in the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Calyptranthes tovarensis plays an important ecological role in its environment, providing nectar for local pollinators.
